channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: EA Shows Why Game Forecasts Are a Tricky Business
item.description: First analyst meeting in eight years falls flat as big projects have few specific details on timing.

item.title: 23andMe’s independent directors quit in clash with CEO over buyout plan
item.description: The directors said the decision comes after months of work that failed to result in an actionable plan that meets the interests of non-affiliated shar...

item.title: U.S. Crude Oil Stockpiles Fall in Week Ended Sept. 13
item.description: Commercial crude oil stockpiles excluding the Strategic Petroleum Reserve fell by 1.6 million barrels to 417.5 million barrels in the week ended Sept....

item.title: Want to stay in a 5-star European hotel for $140 a night? Follow this travel rule.
item.description: Avoid the major cities and visit under-the-radar destinations to save big bucks. Who needs Paris when you can have Poland?

item.title: Get Ready to See Stock Prices in Half-Pennies
item.description: The SEC is set to vote on a change to market rules that would cause the prices of many stocks to be quoted in increments of $0.005, which it says will...

item.title: Amazon wants staff back in the office 5 days a week. Your boss isn’t likely to follow suit.
item.description: For all of Amazon’s clout, its plans likely won’t motivate many other businesses to follow with their own five-day in-person workweek, according to so...

item.title: Lithium Gets a Charge, but Oversupply Still Looms
item.description: The metal, which is used to make batteries for both gadgets and electric vehicles, has been on a roller-coaster ride in recent years.

item.title: Oil futures trim losses after fall in U.S. crude inventories
item.description: Oil futures trimmed losses Wednesday, after government data showed U.S. crude inventories fell last week and traders awaited a Federal Reserve decisio...

item.title: Mets Owner Steve Cohen to Stop Trading for His Hedge Fund
item.description: The billionaire plans to remain at the firm and focus on strategy and mentoring.

item.title: We have $1 million in high-yield savings and CDs set aside to buy a house. Should we move our money if the Fed cuts rates?
item.description: We have a lot of cash on hand for a specific purpose, but we won’t be able to live off the income if interest rates drop.
